newsitem.title: CYPRUS: EuroMPs slam Turk Cypriot leader over visit terms.
newsitem.headline: EuroMPs slam Turk Cypriot leader over visit terms.

text.p: European parliamentarians visiting Cyprus refused on Wednesday to cross to the Turkish- held north after demands they meet members of the Turkish Cypriot administration.

"They wanted us to meet with their so-called foreign minister, give us an official escort and an official luncheon," said Philippe Monfils, a Belgian MP and co-chair of the European Union-Cyprus Joint Parliamentary Committee.
"That would be tantamount to recognition... Mr. Denktash's attitude by many European MPs was considered scandalous," Monfils told a news conference in southern Nicosia.

The breakaway Turkish Cypriot state in northern Cyprus, headed by Rauf Denktash and recognised only by Ankara, had approved a visit by the Euro-MPs to the few hundred elderly Greek Cypriots who still live in the north.
But Monfils, an MP from the European Liberal Democratic Reform Group, said the conditions put by the breakaway state were unacceptable and the issue would be raised in the European Parliament.

Greek and Turkish Cypriots have been separated by a U.N.-patrolled buffer zone since 1974, when Turkish troops invaded the island's north after a Greek Cypriot coup engineered by the military then ruling Athens.

United Nations efforts to reunite the island as a bi-communal, bi-zonal federation have recently gained pace. International mediators are hoping face-to-face negotiations can start between the Greek and Turkish Cypriot community leaders this year to pave the way towards a comprehensive settlement.
